oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian ceramic figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian bean-shaped ceramic figure, rounded at the bottom with sculpted hands. Two holes on each side opposite of each other and evidence of a possible head that was broken off at the neck. One large hole revealing a hollow cavity with an incised design below it as well as near the neck area on the front side.
Overall good condition besides the break at the neck. Regular wear but fine details can be made out.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
